jsonEvents.name: Four O'clock Exam Day 4
jsonEvents.summary: Four O'clock Exam Day 4

jsonEvents.name: Candidate for the Vice President for Equity and Community Open Discussion
jsonEvents.summary: A candidate for the Vice President for Equity and Community will provide a Presentation and Open Discussion to the campus community at 4:00 p.m. in the Admissions Theater, Alumni Memorial Building on November 9th.

jsonEvents.name: Colloquium: Bruno de Oliveira, University of Miami at Coral Gables
jsonEvents.summary: Weekly Department Colloquium features Bruno de Oliveira from the University of Miami in Florida.

jsonEvents.name: Lehigh in Scotland Information Session
jsonEvents.summary: Come learn about earning 6 credits studying abroad in Scotland next summer on an archaeological dig!

jsonEvents.name: Seminar: Professor Ming An, Binghamton University
jsonEvents.summary: Seminar: Professor Ming An, Binghamton University

jsonEvents.name: Global Cuisine Presents France
jsonEvents.summary: Please come to Rathbone to taste the French cuisine!

jsonEvents.name: Pushing the Envelopes: Censorship and Social Media in Southeast Asia
jsonEvents.summary: There will be Lehigh professors to speak about the new social media age and censorship policies that are currently found in certain Southeast Asian countries. It will be engaging, informative, and open discussion.

jsonEvents.name: Friendsgiving
jsonEvents.summary: Share a free traditional Thanksgiving meal with fellow Lehigh students, faculty, staff and community members. Make some friends and enjoy a uniquely American tradition!

jsonEvents.name: Spin
jsonEvents.summary: Spin is a great way to stay in shape and burn calories fast.  It's an intense, vigorous workout where we ride to the beat of powerful music. Spinning helps tone muscles while building the cardiovascular system. Come ride with us!

jsonEvents.name: Zumba
jsonEvents.summary: Zumba is an exhilarating, effective, easy-to-follow, Latin-inspired, calorie-burning dance-fitness class that combines intervals of fast and slow rhythms to tone and sculpt your body while burning fat.

jsonEvents.name: Women ONLY (R.A.D.) Rape Aggression Defense Program Classes
jsonEvents.summary: The LUPD would like to remind students, staff and faculty that we are, once again, offering self-defense instruction through the Rape Aggression Defense, or RAD Program.

jsonEvents.name: Learn to Play Squash at Taylor Gym: Session II
jsonEvents.summary: Taylor Gym will offer two sessions this fall to help you learn the sport of squash with a starter course in the fundamentals. Each session will run 3 weeks and offer 6 lessons.

jsonEvents.name: Strength and Core
jsonEvents.summary: Experience the benefits of strength training and core conditioning using a variety of equipment, including weighted body bars, dumb bells, and resistance tubing. This fun, energetic class uses intense and powerful music to motivate and drive you.

jsonEvents.name: Tartuffe By Molière: Translated By Richard Wilbur
jsonEvents.summary: This French comedy comes to life in a sparkling English verse translation. Orgon has taken into his home the righteous, pious and virtuous Tartuffe. When the rest of the family doubts Tartuffe’s virtue, traps are set, masks are dropped.

jsonEvents.name: ...Of The Americas: Contemporary Latin American Art
jsonEvents.summary: Latin American Art Is American Art. Abstraction, conceptualism, the politics of identity.

jsonEvents.name: Four O'clock Exam Day 5
jsonEvents.summary: Four O'clock Exam Day 5

jsonEvents.name: Visual and Verbal: The Deborah and Alfred Judson Barcan Collection, An Exhibit in Linderman Library
jsonEvents.summary: Please visit the Linderman exhibit featuring highlights of the Barcans’ gift to Special Collections. On display are selected works of Mark Twain, Walter Crane, William Morris, and Lewis Carroll, as well as early New York City guidebooks.

jsonEvents.name: Changes to Flexible Benefits Information Sessions
jsonEvents.summary: Human Resources is hosting information sessions to introduce the changes to Lehigh's 2017 Flexible Benefits Plan. Light refreshments will be provided.

jsonEvents.name: Financing Study Abroad: You Can't Afford NOT to Go
jsonEvents.summary: This will be a session about internal and external scholarships and financial aid for studying abroad.

jsonEvents.name: Gender in a Global Context
jsonEvents.summary: Please join the event and have a close look at how Thai culturally treats food and it's connection to gender roles!

jsonEvents.name: Info Session on Spring Break Trip to Israel-Palestine
jsonEvents.summary: The focus of the trip (March 10-19, 2017) will be on inter-religious encounter and dialogue as a way to peace.  Come to the info session to hear more details and how to apply.

jsonEvents.name: Loi Krathong & Thai Beauty Standards: A Gender in a Global Context
jsonEvents.summary: A Gender in a Global Context Discussion: Loi Krathong and Thai Beauty Standards

jsonEvents.name: Sustainable Sushi Lunch
jsonEvents.summary: Join Eco-Reps and Global Union for Sustainable Sushi Lunch!

jsonEvents.name: Strength and Core
jsonEvents.summary: Experience the benefits of strength training and core conditioning using a variety of equipment, including weighted body bars, dumb bells, and resistance tubing. This fun, energetic class uses intense and powerful music to motivate and drive you.

jsonEvents.name: Yoga Flow
jsonEvents.summary: Experience the benefits of yoga through a sequence of dynamic stretching and strengthening postures that will bring you towards a deeper awareness of your physical body. By matching breath to movement, you will begin to find more balance in your life

jsonEvents.name: Colloquium with Brooks Thomas, Lafayette College
jsonEvents.location: Sherman Fairchild Center for the Physical Sciences
jsonEvents.summary: You're cordially invited to attend Prof. Thomas'seminar entitled
Thursday, November 10, 2016 at 4:10PM in LL 512.

jsonEvents.name: Grief, Love, and Memory in Modern Tibetan Buddhism
jsonEvents.summary: Each year, the Friends of the Lehigh University Libraries sponsor a talk by a newer member of the Lehigh University faculty designed to share faculty research with a broader campus and community audience.

jsonEvents.name: International Relations Efron Speaker: Jennifer Dixon
jsonEvents.summary: Changing the State's Story: The Politics of Dark Pasts in Turkey and Japan

jsonEvents.name: Zero Motivation
jsonEvents.summary: There will an Isralie film screening,
, a comedy about women serving in the Israeli Army.  The film, which is a smart, funny, and candid look at female roles in the army and a unique take on Israeli culture.

jsonEvents.name: Bootycamp
jsonEvents.summary: This high intensity total body conditioning class will get your heart rate up and blood pumping! Focus will be on strengthening and toning your lower body, in particular the lower abdominals, legs, and glutes!

jsonEvents.name: CAS-Join the Dialogue
jsonEvents.summary: Film Screening followed by discussion with Zach Ingrasci, Filmmaker. Join the Dialogue event

jsonEvents.name: Salam Neighbor Screening and Keynote
jsonEvents.summary: Zach Ingrasci, a film-maker, will be brought to campus to discuss his documentary. Salam Neighbor, which follows the lives of Zach and a friend.

jsonEvents.name: International Poetry Night
jsonEvents.summary: Readers will recite poetry in a language of their choosing, while the original and an English translation will be displayed.

jsonEvents.name: Sri Lankan Culture Night
jsonEvents.summary: Please come and join this event to learn the culture from the Sri Lankan student!

jsonEvents.name: Power Yoga
jsonEvents.summary: Power Yoga is a challenging style of yoga designed to build strength, flexibility, stamina, and balance.  The core of each class is based upon a vinyasa flow that includes a series of sun salutations, balance-challenging standing postures.

jsonEvents.name: Donnel Foster Hewett Symposium: Signicance of a Changing Arctic
jsonEvents.summary: Earth and Environmental Sciences Department  2016 Donnel Foster Hewett Symposium  Signicance of a Changing Arctic

jsonEvents.name: Everyday Feminist Book Discussion Group
jsonEvents.summary: This discussion group is open to everyone on campus, even if you are new to the topic. Come discuss contemporary and celebrity feminism in Andi Zeisler's We Were Feminists Once.

jsonEvents.name: Thursday Night Trivia
jsonEvents.summary: Come out to the Hawk's Nest at 10 PM every Thursday night to compete in Thursday Night Trivia! There will be music, food, and lots of prizes to win!

jsonEvents.name: Bartram’s Boxes REMIX Gallery Exhibit
jsonEvents.summary: When 13 trees fell at Bartram’s Garden during a huge storm in 2010, the Philadelphia Center for Art in Wood put out a call to artists, inviting them to propose and create new works using the fallen wood and other materials in the spirit of the garden

jsonEvents.name: Online Harassment Training Reminder Deadline
jsonEvents.summary: Online harassment training is accessed through coursesite.lehigh.edu. Students:
; Faculty and Staff:
Training must be completed prior to November 11, 2016.  inogc@lehigh.edu w/questions

jsonEvents.name: MHDI/CITL Workshop: Introduction to WordPress for Humanists
jsonEvents.summary: This workshop will teach you how to use the digital publishing tool WordPress, and will provide ideas for how to use WordPress in research and teaching. This workshop is for beginners who have never built a website or blog before.

jsonEvents.name: Eating Disorders in College: A Feminist Friday Discussion
jsonEvents.summary: This discussion will focus on eating disorders in college. Snacks provided.

jsonEvents.name: International Internships
jsonEvents.summary: This will be an info session about international internships, including Iacocca International Internships Program.

jsonEvents.name: Men's Cross Country: Lehigh vs NCAA Mid-Atlantic Regional
jsonEvents.summary: Men's Cross Country: Lehigh vs NCAA Mid-Atlantic Regional

jsonEvents.name: Pre-Law Luncheon II: Use Data to Learn about Law and Law Schools
jsonEvents.summary: Learn how to use data provided on a number of websites to explore law schools and a legal career. Lunch is provided. RSVP to attend.

jsonEvents.name: Pushing the Envelope and Tackling Tough Topics Together: Divided Nations
jsonEvents.summary: Our professor and students will discuss a very sensitive topic between China and Taiwan.

jsonEvents.name: Women's Cross Country: Lehigh vs NCAA Mid-Atlantic Regional
jsonEvents.summary: Women's Cross Country: Lehigh vs NCAA Mid-Atlantic Regional

jsonEvents.name: Cardio Kickboxing
jsonEvents.summary: A fun and invigorating training program designed to challenge you both mentally and physically.  Incorporating high intensity kicking routines with upper body drills, this class will help you increase your stamina, coordination, and strength.

jsonEvents.name: Spin
jsonEvents.summary: Spin is a great way to stay in shape and burn calories fast.  It's an intense, vigorous workout where we ride to the beat of powerful music. Spinning helps tone muscles while building the cardiovascular system.  Come ride with us.

jsonEvents.name: Drop in Nutrition Counseling at Taylor Gym
jsonEvents.summary: New this year!  Carrie Gerencher, the on campus registered dietitian, will have office hours at Taylor Gym on Mondays from 11-1pm and Fridays 1-3pm.  There will be a sign up sheet in the main workout area if you'd like to meet with her.
